|brand = TP-LINK |model = TL-WN8200ND |submodelappend = <!-- yes, for space --> |submodel = <!-- SubModel number, Leave blank for unknown --> |revision = v1 |subrevision = <!-- Model Subrevision, Leave blank for none or unknown --> |model_part_num = |page_start_date = |page_start_origon = |sernum = <!-- Serial number prefix --> |wlclass = N300 |series = <!-- Device series --> |if = USB |if_bus_version = 2.0 |ifconnector = Female Mini-B |formfactor = corded (modular) adapter
|vendor_id = 2357 |device_id = 0100 |subvendor_id = <!-- Leave blank for none --> |subdevice_id = <!-- Leave blank for none --> |id_string = <!-- PnP ID string --> |windosid = <!-- Windows ID, Leave blank for none --> |fcc_id = TE7WN8200ND |icid = 8853A-WN8200ND |boardid = <!-- Board ID --> |ecc_id = <!-- eec-id --> |oui = 60:E3:27
|chip1 = Realtek;RTL8192CU; |chip2 = <!-- Brand;Model;Extra, info; --> |chip3 = <!-- Brand;Model;Extra, info; --> |chip4 = <!-- Brand;Model;Extra, info; -->
|antconn = RP-SMA |antenna = <!-- Antenna type --> |txchains = 1 |rxchains = 2 |sstreams = 2 |wirelessstand = IEEE 802.11b/g/n |802.11n = 300 |802.11g = 54 |802.11b = 11 |wififreq = 2.4 |receive_sens = <!-- Receive sensitivity --> |transmit_power = <!-- Transmit power -->
|linuxdriv = |windriv =

|availability = <!-- Market availability --> |eoldate = <!-- End of Life date --> |fccapprovdate = 01/30/2013 |estreldate = <!-- Estimated release date --> |price = <!-- Estimated retail price in US dollars --> |upc = 845973050740 |ean = 6935364050740 |dx_sku = <!-- DealExtreme sku --> |asin = B00A8GVNNY |asin_country = <!-- ASIN country --> |asin2 = B00ATXJN60 |asin_country2 = <!-- ASIN country --> |country = China

}}{{TIDTOC|adapter}} ==Overview== "2052500384" and "Rev:1.0" is silkscreened on the board in the FCC photos.
{{WiFiCert|WFA17198|12/04/2012}}
==Links of Interest== *[http://uk.hardware.info/productinfo/165230/tp-link-tl-wn8200nd On '''Hardware.info'''] *[http://www.spinics.net/lists/linux-wireless/msg109038.html On the '''linux-wireless''' mailing list] :'''rtl8192cu''' may not be working properly with this device at the moment<!-- and with any other device for that matter --> :Note: the patch adding USB ID is targeted for inclusion in kernel 3.11, :'''Realtek''''s vendor driver may be the only option ATM :Note 2: Vendor's driver does not work either - :- [http://www.spinics.net/lists/linux-wireless/msg111656.html one report] indicates a lack of MIMO support. :On 2.10.2014 the device still has no working driver: [https://github.com/pvaret/rtl8192cu-fixes/issues/19#issuecomment-54183712 issue on github].
